body_html:
@peterjc123 Thanks for all your great work.
Your Windows installation seems to run perfectly for my colleague.

However when I try to replicate his setup, I get really bad python kernel crashes.
The only difference is that I am using pytorch 0.3.0 and he uses and older version.
I have attached the script that kills my kernel.

My system settings are:
Windows-10-10.0.14393-SP0
Python 3.6.3 |Anaconda custom (64-bit)| (default, Oct 15 2017, 03:27:45) [MSC v.1900 64 bit (AMD64)]
NumPy 1.13.3
SciPy 0.19.1
Scikit-Learn 0.19.1
PyTorch 0.3.0b0+591e73e
CUDA available: False
CUDA version: None

Any help is very much appreciated.

simpleTest.zip

body:
@peterjc123 Thanks for all your great work. 
Your Windows installation seems to run perfectly for my colleague. 

However when I try to replicate his setup, I get really bad python kernel crashes.
The only difference is that I am using pytorch 0.3.0 and he uses and older version.
I have attached the script that kills my kernel.

My system settings are:
Windows-10-10.0.14393-SP0
Python 3.6.3 |Anaconda custom (64-bit)| (default, Oct 15 2017, 03:27:45) [MSC v.1900 64 bit (AMD64)]
NumPy 1.13.3
SciPy 0.19.1
Scikit-Learn 0.19.1
PyTorch 0.3.0b0+591e73e
CUDA available: False
CUDA version: None

Any help is very much appreciated.

[simpleTest.zip](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/files/1604240/simpleTest.zip)
